question:
In a techie park, a building houses six companies: A, B, C, D, E and F on different floors. The ground floor is numbered as 1 and the floor above the ground floor is numbered as 2 and so on. Company A is on the floor above B, but is below C. Company D is on the ground floor and E is on the floor immediate below B. Company F is on the topmost floor.
How many companies are there between Company C and Company D?
solution:
6

F

5

C

4

A

3

B

2

E

1

D

There are three companies between Company C and Company D.

question: A certain number of people are sitting in a row, facing North. U sits fourth to the right of T. Exactly seven people sit between P and S, while S is on the right side of P. Q sits third to the left of S. P sits third to the right of R. Exactly three people sit between S and T, while T is on the right side of S. If no other person is sitting in the row, what is the total number of persons seated?
solution: https://appx-content-v2.classx.co.in/website/bulk_uploader_images/1749213612668_image001.png

question: As a punishment, a teacher asked 11 students of her class, standing in a row, to tell the tables of 2 to 12, respectively, as per their sequence number in the row. Reshma’s sequence number was 3ʳᵈ so she had to tell the table of 4. But she forgot the table and exchanged her position with Joseph, the 3ʳᵈ last student in the row. Now, Reshma had to tell the table of which number?
solution:
The correct answer is: c

  1. The students are assigned tables based on their sequence number in the row. So, the 1st student tells the table of 2, the 2nd student tells the table of 3, the 3rd student tells the table of 4, and so on up to the 11th student telling the table of 12.
  2. Reshma was originally in the 3rd position, meaning she had to tell the table of 4.
  3. Joseph was the 3rd last student, meaning he was in the 9th position (since the total number of students is 11).
  4. When Reshma swapped places with Joseph, she moved to the 9th position in the row.
  5. The student in the 9th position was assigned the table of 10.

Thus, after swapping, Reshma had to tell the table of 10.

question: Vijay has a collection of five ribbons, A, B, C, D and E, each of different length. A is longer than B. A is longer than E. C is longer than D. B is longer than E. E is longer than C. Which ribbon is the shortest?
solution:
Explanation:

  • From E > C and C > D, we can conclude E > C > D.
  • From B > E, we know B > E > C > D.
  • From A > B, we get A > B > E > C > D.

Thus, D is the shortest ribbon.

question:
A company provides apartments in a building to its five employees, namely, manager, CEO, CFO, accountant and assistant. The ground floor is numbered as the second floor and the floor above the ground floor as the third floor and so on. Only one employee lives between the floors on which the CEO and CFO live. The CFO lives on the floor immediately above the floor on which the assistant lives. The accountant lives on an even numbered floor but not immediately below the floor on which the CFO lives. The manager lives on the fifth floor.

On which floor does the accountant live?
solution:
Floor Number

Employee

6th

CEO

5th

Manager

4th

CFO

3rd

Assistant

2nd

Accountant

Therefore, Accountant lives on the 2nd floor.

question: A cloth storekeeper bought a new rack having eight shelves. The bottom shelf is numbered as number 1; the shelf above it is numbered as number 2 and so on. He arranges all his clothes on the basis of their colours: red, black, yellow, blue, green, gold, white and silver. Yellow coloured clothes are placed on the third shelf. Only two coloured clothes are placed between the shelves containing yellow and white coloured clothes. Silver coloured clothes are placed on the shelf immediately above the shelf containing black coloured clothes. Only one coloured clothes are placed between the shelves containing green and gold coloured clothes. Green coloured clothes are placed above the shelf containing gold coloured clothes. Only one coloured clothes are placed between the shelves containing yellow and blue coloured clothes. Blue coloured clothes are placed on one of the shelves below the shelf containing green coloured clothes. Which of the following coloured clothes are placed exactly between the shelves of yellow and blue coloured clothes?
solution:
Therefore, Gold coloured cloth is placed between Yellow and Blue coloured clothes.


https://appx-content-v2.classx.co.in/paperimages/1753430965_1753430965556018_thump.png

question: Seven boys namely A, D, G, L, N, P and M are sitting in a row facing north. L is seated in the middle. G is not the immediate neighbour of N and P. P is fourth to the right of A, who is seated immediate left of L. N is seated at one of the ends. D is the immediate neighbour of A. How many boys are seated between D and P?
solution: https://appx-content-v2.classx.co.in/website/bulk_uploader_images/1749213612668_image003.png

question: Five friends, U, V, W, X and Y scored different marks in a test. V scored more than X. U scored more than V but less than W. X scored more than Y. Out of the five friends, which friend scored more than exactly two people and less than exactly two people?
solution:
The correct order of marks in the test is:

W > U > V > X > Y

Therefore, V scored more than exactly two people and less than exactly two people.

question: In the final tournament of a football match, player J scored more goals than player K. Player L scored less goals than player M but more goals than player K. Player N scored the least goals among all. Player J scored fewer goals than player L. Who scored the most goals among all players?
solution:
The correct sequence of goals are:

M > L > J > K > N

M scored the most number of goals among all the players.

question:

The bottom layer is numbered as 2 and the layer just above the bottom layer is numbered as 3 and so on. There is only one layer between black currant and red velvet. The red velvet layer is just above the strawberry layer. Chocolate is an even numbered layer below the red velvet layer but not immediately below. Vanilla is the fifth layer.

Red velvet flavour is in which layer?
solution:
6th

Black Currant

5th

Vanilla

4th

Red Velvet

3rd

Strawberry

2nd

Chocolate

Red velvet is in fourth layer.

question:
Study the following information carefully and answer the questions that follow.
In a tennis championship, player A won more matches than player B. Player C won fewer matches than player D but more than player B. Player E won the fewest matches of all. Player A won fewer matches than player C.

Who among the players won the second highest number of matches?
solution:
The correct order of matches won by the players:

D > C > A > B > E

Therefore, C won the second highest number of matches.

question:

solution:
Spinach

Potatoes

Onion

Ginger

Ginger is at the bottom-most part of the stair-case.
